meanings.definition: The quality or state of being similar; resemblance.
meanings.sent1: The similitude between the twins was striking.
meanings.sent2: The similitude of their features made them easily mistaken for each other.
meanings.sent3: The similitude in their taste in music led to many shared playlists.
meanings.sent4: The similitude of their personalities was like looking into a mirror.
meanings.sent5: The similitude in their mannerisms was uncanny.

meanings.sent1: The similitude between the two situations was clear.
meanings.sent2: She used a similitude between a seed and an idea to explain creativity.
meanings.sent3: The similitude of her laughter to a chirping bird always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His similitude of life to a rollercoaster ride was both insightful and amusing.
meanings.sent5: The similitude of the two paintings was like finding a hidden treasure.
